      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void coins(int n)
      This method takes in an int n which represents cents and outputs all possible combinations of coins, using 3 nested loops, one for each coin, except for pennies, which are just the leftover It then adds up all possible combinations and prints how many combinations are possible.
      static boolean isDivisible(int n)
      This method checks to see if an integer n is divisible by 3 without using the modulo operator and uses the sumDigits method as well.
      static void leastCoins(int n)
      This method takes in an int n which represents cents and outputs the combination of coins that will add up to cents, but using the fewest total number of coins possible.
      static void multiples(int n)
      This method takes in the number of rows as a parameter and prints a “Multiple Table.” This method's algorithm uses a nested for loop, i to start each new column, and j for the multiples in each row
      static void printMoreStars(int n)
      This method takes in an integer n and prints stars in a rhombus format, corresponding to the integer n
      static void printRecursive(int n)
      This method prints a triangle made of stars, the first row has 1 star, the final row has n stars Uses the recursiveHelper() function to decide how many stars are in each row, and then printRecursive() decides how many rows are in the triangle
      static void printRecursive2(int n)
      This method prints a triangle that has n stars in the first row and 1 star in the last row.
      static void printStars(int n)
      This method prints n stars on one line using a for loop, printing one star every time it loops
      static void printTriangle(int n)
      This method takes in integer n and prints a triangle with one star in the first row, two stars in the second row, and so on, up to n stars in the last row.
      static void recursiveHelper(int n)
      This method is a helper function that aids the functions printRecursive() and printRecursive2(), using recursion to take care of printing stars on each line, while the other functions take care of switching to a different row
      static int rollDie(int n)
      This method takes in an int n and then returns the result of rolling a die with n sides; uses Math.random() function to choose a random number between 1 and n, both inclusive
      static int sumDigits(int n)
      This function calculates and returns the sum of all the digits of a given non-negative integer using recursion.
      static int swap(int n)
      This method that, given a positive integer n a parameter, computes and returns a new integer in which the units and tens digits have swapped places
      static java.lang.String toBinary(int n)
      This method converts a decimal (base 10) number to a binary (base 2) number using a while loop and a specific algorithm.
      static void xor()
      This method just prints 3 different possibilities of the Boolean expression XOR that involves two boolean variables which is true if and only if exactly one of the two variables has the value true

      • toBinary

        public static java.lang.String toBinary(int n)
        This method converts a decimal (base 10) number to a binary (base 2) number using a while loop and a specific algorithm. At first, the binary number is backwards, so a while loop is used to flip it
        Parameters:
        n - the integer that is (base 10)
        Returns:
        s the string of the binary version of the n decimal number

      • rollDie

        public static int rollDie(int n)
        This method takes in an int n and then returns the result of rolling a die with n sides; uses Math.random() function to choose a random number between 1 and n, both inclusive
        Parameters:
        n - the integer that decides how many sides the die has
        Returns:
        rand the random integer on the die with n sides

      • multiples

        public static void multiples(int n)
        This method takes in the number of rows as a parameter and prints a “Multiple Table.” This method's algorithm uses a nested for loop, i to start each new column, and j for the multiples in each row
        Parameters:
        n - the integer that determines how many rows there are in the tabl

      • swap

        public static int swap(int n)
        This method that, given a positive integer n a parameter, computes and returns a new integer in which the units and tens digits have swapped places
        Parameters:
        n - the original integer in which tens and units places are being swapped
        Returns:
        number the new integer in which tens and units places are already swapped

      • xor

        public static void xor()
        This method just prints 3 different possibilities of the Boolean expression XOR that involves two boolean variables which is true if and only if exactly one of the two variables has the value true

      • printStars

        public static void printStars(int n)
        This method prints n stars on one line using a for loop, printing one star every time it loops
        Parameters:
        n - the integer that determines how many stars there should be

      • printTriangle

        public static void printTriangle(int n)
        This method takes in integer n and prints a triangle with one star in the first row, two stars in the second row, and so on, up to n stars in the last row. Uses printStars() method to execute function, which undergoes the printStars loop, inside the printTriangle loop, making it a nested loop
        Parameters:
        n - the integer that determines the size of triangle

      • printRecursive

        public static void printRecursive(int n)
        This method prints a triangle made of stars, the first row has 1 star, the final row has n stars Uses the recursiveHelper() function to decide how many stars are in each row, and then printRecursive() decides how many rows are in the triangle
        Parameters:
        n - the integer that decides how many rows are in the triangle

      • printRecursive2

        public static void printRecursive2(int n)
        This method prints a triangle that has n stars in the first row and 1 star in the last row. Uses the recursiveHelper() function to decide how many stars should go in each row then printRecursive2() decides how many rows are in the triangle
        Parameters:
        n - the integer that decides how many rows are in the triangle and decides how many stars are in the first row

      • recursiveHelper

        public static void recursiveHelper(int n)
        This method is a helper function that aids the functions printRecursive() and printRecursive2(), using recursion to take care of printing stars on each line, while the other functions take care of switching to a different row
        Parameters:
        n - the integer that determines how many stars should be in a row

      • sumDigits

        public static int sumDigits(int n)
        This function calculates and returns the sum of all the digits of a given non-negative integer using recursion. It takes leftover of n divided by 10, then the remainder when that is divided by 10. Then it divides n by 10, and the sum is then the leftover plus the new value of n put through the sumDigits method again.
        Parameters:
        n - the non-negative integer that its digits are being added
        Returns:
        sum the sum of all the digits after recursion is finished

      • isDivisible

        public static boolean isDivisible(int n)
        This method checks to see if an integer n is divisible by 3 without using the modulo operator and uses the sumDigits method as well. It is a recursive boolean method, that eventually checks to see continuing subtracting 3, if it eventually becomes 0, it returns true, if the number is eventually less than 0 but never 0, returns false
        Parameters:
        n - the integer that is being checked if it is divisible by 3

      • printMoreStars

        public static void printMoreStars(int n)
        This method takes in an integer n and prints stars in a rhombus format, corresponding to the integer n
        Parameters:
        n - the integer that determines shape of stars

      • leastCoins

        public static void leastCoins(int n)
        This method takes in an int n which represents cents and outputs the combination of coins that will add up to cents, but using the fewest total number of coins possible. Uses two different arrays, with the first array containing the values of the different coins, and the second array contains how many coins for each is needed
        Parameters:
        n - the integer amt. of cents

      • coins

        public static void coins(int n)
        This method takes in an int n which represents cents and outputs all possible combinations of coins, using 3 nested loops, one for each coin, except for pennies, which are just the leftover It then adds up all possible combinations and prints how many combinations are possible.
        Parameters:
        n - the integer that signifies how much cents should be distributed throughout all possibilities of coins.
